did.unittitle: Office of New Haven and State Affairs, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of purchase and sale agreements and correspondence documenting Yale's acquisition of West Campus, formerly Bayer HealthCare.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Office of New Haven and State Affairs

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 4-D (YRG 4-D), Records documenting community relations of Yale University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were transferred from the Office of New Haven and State Affairs, 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Office of New Haven and State Affairs, Yale University, Records (RU 1107). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Yale University Office of New Haven and State Affairs (ONHSA) provides a front door to Yale and its resources for the people and organizations of Greater New Haven. Working with other University departments and our neighbors in New Haven, ONHSA spearheads Yale's partnerships to strengthen New Haven through fostering economic development, revitalizing neighborhoods, supporting public school and youth programs, and creating a vital downtown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of purchase and sale agreements and correspondence documenting Yale's acquisition of West Campus, formerly Bayer HealthCare.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by type of material.

accessrestrict.p: Restricted 35 years from end of tenure of Vice President Alexander.
